books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Vicomte de Bragelonne
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.summary: The events of the early days of Louis XIV’s majority reign in France, including the continuing story of the four musketeers who served both Louis XIV’s father and himself.

books.title: The Autobiography of Mark Twain
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A collection of reminiscences and reflections from the author’s experiences.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Story of the Treasure Seekers
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Six siblings search for treasure in order to restore their lost family fortune.

books.title: The Way of the World
books.author: William Congreve
books.summary: Two lovers are prevented from marrying due to a previous dalliance.

books.title: Heartbreak House
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Men and women of the English leisured classes gather at a country house on the eve of war to discuss love, life, and the future.

books.title: The Worm Ouroboros
books.author: E. R. Eddison
books.summary: The King Gorice of Witchland and the lords of Demonland wage war in the high-fantasy lands of Mercury.

books.title: The Son of the Wolf
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A collection of stories entailing life during the gold rush in the harsh wilderness of northwestern North America.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: The Sign of the Four
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: An analytical detective is consulted by a young woman who has received a strange communication regarding her long-missing father and a mysterious treasure.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.

books.title: On Liberty
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: Mill’s famous essay that applies a utilitarian ethical system to systems of government.

books.title: The Argonautica
books.author: Apollonius of Rhodes
books.summary: A Greek hero voyages to a distant land to steal the fabled Golden Fleece.

books.title: Gulliver’s Travels
books.author: Jonathan Swift
books.summary: An Englishman travels to fictional islands where he meets tiny people, giants, magicians and talking horses.

books.title: The Moon Pool
books.author: A. Merritt
books.summary: A group of adventurers search for their friends, who were lost while exploring the otherworldly secrets of a monument discovered on a chain of island ruins.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by Ray Bradbury ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
